tasks.task: Farming and Rice Cultivation in Laos
subtasks: Planting rice in fields prone to drought and flooding
Using specially bred Lao modern variety (LMV) rice
Participating in the Lao-Erie Research and Training Project
Implementing new agronomy techniques for high-yielding rice
Managing rice self-sufficiency and food security
Preserving traditional indigenous rice varieties through a gene bank
Training farmers and staff in rice cultivation and conservation methods
Sloping farmland across mountain faces to manage terrain
Overcoming water-related challenges (drought and flooding) in rice cultivation
Rural households relying on agriculture as the main livelihood
Farmers sharing feedback and seed information for variety improvement
Achieving food self-sufficiency through successful rice production
Marking the 15-year partnership with the International Rice Research Institute
Acknowledging farmers' contributions and successes with high-yielding rice
Highlighting the importance of rice in daily life (70% calorie requirement)

tasks.task: Addressing persistent challenges in rice sufficiency
subtasks: Recognizing the annual sufficiency gap of 6.8 months in the Pour
